definition: Rostov-on-Don, Russian river port and regional capital close to Sea of Azov (north of the Black Sea)
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]
prop/support (for weight)/rest (e.g. arm rest)/thanks to/to hold in one's hand/to support in one's palm/to give/to base/to commit/to set/torr (unit of pressure)
(classical) this, that/he, she, they/(exclamatory final particle)/(initial particle, introduces an opinion)

sentences.english: After Nikolay's departure, it was more depressing than ever in the Rostovs' house.
sentences.chinese: 尼古拉離開之後，羅斯托夫家中比任何時候更憂鬱了。

sentences.english: When Rostov talked of it, Denisov did not listen.
sentences.chinese: 當羅斯托夫談論此事的時候，傑尼索夫不聽他說話。

sentences.english: NEAR THE VILLAGE of Pratzen Rostov had been told to look for Kutuzov and the Emperor.
sentences.chinese: 羅斯托夫奉命在普拉茨村附近尋找庫圖佐夫和國王。

sentences.english: The Rostovs' party stopped for that night at Mytishtchy, twenty versts from Moscow.
sentences.chinese: 羅斯托夫家的車隊當晚停留在梅季希村。

sentences.english: Chikatilo was executed in Rostov on February 14, 1994.
sentences.chinese: 1994年2月14日奇卡緹洛在羅斯托夫被處死。

sentences.english: And all the summer of 1812 the Rostovs did not visit the country.
sentences.chinese: 一八一二年夏季羅斯托夫一家沒有到鄉下去。

sentences.english: Rostov flushing hotly drew Dolohov away into the other room.
sentences.chinese: 羅斯托夫面紅耳赤，把多洛霍夫喊到另一間房裏。

sentences.english: One of the generals who rode by was an acquaintance of the Rostovs.
sentences.chinese: 在路過的將軍中有一位是羅斯托夫家的熟人。

sentences.english: Rostov almost screamed, putting both his hands up to his hair.
sentences.chinese: 羅斯托夫伸出一雙手，托住了頭髮，幾乎喊了一聲。

definition: La Coruña or A Coruña (city in Galicia, Spain)

pinyin: Ma3 si1 te4 li3 he4 te4

definition: to mess sth up/to screw up
Vanuatu, country in the southwestern Pacific Ocean
Nelson or Nillson (name)/Horatio Nelson (1758-1805), British naval hero
variant of 亞美尼亞|亚美尼亚[Ya4 mei3 ni2 ya4], Armenia
